page.title: 04ADAPTATION OF VILLAGES.
page.content:
{COASTAL VILLAGES. { } The coastal villages were originally fishing and farming villages but are now mainly orientated torwards{tourism,}which is very important to the area during summer. The income from tourism made during the summer months has to be sufficient to be able to support the villages during the leaner winter months. At Torcross there are two large hotels and a number of Bed and Breakfast establishments, while at Beesands there is a large caravan site.
